alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Larue (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 11:06PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, Hardin, Larue and Nelson. * WHEN...Until 215 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1106 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elizabethtown, Hodgenville, New Haven, Roanoke, Leafdale, Boundary Oak, Tonieville, Mathers Mill, Athertonville and Lyons. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
